newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Shangri-La launches US$500 mln loan.
newsitem.headline: Shangri-La launches US$500 mln loan.

text.p: Hotel owner Shangri-La Asia Ltd said on Sunday it launched a US$500 million five-year revolving term loan facility.

It carries an interest margin of 0.53 percent per annum, with a three-year revolving credit period after which the outstanding amount will be converted into a term loan, the company said in a statement.
The proceeds will be used for general working capital and to fund the continued expansion of the business of the Shangri-La Asia group companies, it said.
HSBC Investment Bank Asia Ltd, J.P. Morgan Securities Asia Ltd, and Societe Generale Asia Ltd have been appointed coordinating arrangers.
HSBC Investment Bank Asia Ltd and J.P. Morgan Securities Asia Ltd will act as bookrunners and Societe Generale Asia Ltd will act as the agent of the facility.
